--- title: "chattr" description: | AI in RStudio author: Michael Ellsworth date: 2024-04-24 --- I came across [this blog post](https://blogs.rstudio.com/ai/posts/2024-04-04-chat-with-llms-using-chattr/) yesterday while scrolling through #rstats Mastodon and it inspired me to give `chattr` a try in RStudio. Based on the post, it looks like `chattr` simply allows for interaction with LLMs via a Shiny app in RStudio (or outside RStudio in a terminal). Here is the install script: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Install from GitHub library(remotes) remotes::install_github("mlverse/chattr") ``` ::: In the "Getting started" section of the post, running the app is done via the `chattr_app()` function but I'm getting a "No model setup found" error. Running `?chattr_use` in the R Console pulls up some details to resolve this error. Looks like the easiest way to setup a model is to grab an OpenAI Personal Access Token (PAT). My preference would be to run a local LLM but maybe I can look into setting that up later. After creating a PAT on the OpenAI website, I created an .Renviron file in my project directory and saved the token there under `OPENAI_API_KEY`. It looks like that's all it took to set-up the model. I can now run `chattr_app()`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(chattr) chattr::chattr_app() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • Provider: ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • Path/URL: ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • Model: ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • Label: ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} `
Shiny applications not supported in static R Markdown documents
`{=html} ::: ::: This seems to open the Shiny App but sending a prompt to OpenAI doesn't return any response. After an unfortunate amount of time looking through Google, running `chattr::chattr("hello")` gives me an error message that might be a clue to resolving my problem: ``` {error}Type:insufficient_quota Message: You exceeded your current quota, please check your plan and billing details. ``` Based on my usage details on the OpenAI website, I should have plenty of quota to work with. Other folks online have reported a similar issue and have noted that it goes away after a few days. Perhaps I'll check back on this later. This unsuccessful AI exercise reminds me that I need to read Molly White's article [AI isn't useless. But is it worth it?](https://www.citationneeded.news/ai-isnt-useless/). Unfortunately, I'm not sure this foray into `chattr` was worth much today!
